publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3961# Jackie Baillie: Reform of Charity Law—That the Parliament shares the Scottish Executive's commitment to progressing the reform of charity law; recognises that this will assist in developing the contribution of charities to their communities; notes the voluntary sector's call for a charities bill, and welcomes the Executive's commitment to keep the need for such legislation under review.

S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Scott Barrie*, Cathie Craigie*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Margaret Jamieson*, Paul Martin*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Bill Butler*, Robin Harper*, Elaine Thomson*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Alex Fergusson*, Rhoda Grant*, Sarah Boyack*, Bristow Muldoon*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Janis Hughes*, Angus MacKay*, Trish Godman*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Johann Lamont*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-3961# Jackie Baillie: Reform of Charity Law-That the Parliament shares the Scottish Executive's commitment to progressing the reform of charity law; recognises that this will assist in developing the contribution of charities to their communities; notes the voluntary sector's call for a charities bill, and welcomes the Executive's commitment to keep the need for such legislation under review.Supported by: Scott Barrie, Cathie Craigie, Brian Fitzpatrick, Margaret Jamieson, Paul Martin, Mr Jamie Stone, Bill Butler, Robin Harper, Elaine Thomson, Ms Wendy Alexander, Alex Fergusson, Rhoda Grant, Sarah Boyack, Bristow Muldoon, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Michael McMahon, Janis Hughes, Angus MacKay, Trish Godman, Mr Keith Raffan, Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Tom McCabe*
S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Irene Oldfather*, Robert Brown*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Susan Deacon*, Mr John McAllion*, Mr Duncan McNeil*
S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Ian Jenkins*
S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Irene McGugan*
S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-3961# Reform of Charity Law (lodged on 26 February 2003) Karen Whitefield*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Mr Andrew Welsh*

S1M-3961# Jackie Baillie: Reform of Charity Law—That the Parliament shares the Scottish Executive's commitment to progressing the reform of charity law; recognises that this will assist in developing the contribution of charities to their communities; notes the voluntary sector's call for a charities bill, and welcomes the Executive's commitment to keep the need for such legislation under review. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Cathie Craigie, Brian Fitzpatrick, Margaret Jamieson, Paul Martin, Mr Jamie Stone, Bill Butler, Robin Harper, Elaine Thomson, Ms Wendy Alexander, Alex Fergusson, Rhoda Grant, Sarah Boyack, Bristow Muldoon, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Michael McMahon, Janis Hughes, Angus MacKay, Trish Godman, Mr Keith Raffan, Johann Lamont, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Tom McCabe, Irene Oldfather, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Susan Deacon, Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan McNeil, Nora Radcliffe, Ian Jenkins, Irene McGugan, Pauline McNeill, Karen Whitefield, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Andrew Welsh
